intro: Tragia emrichii, commonly known as the Emrich's tragia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with hairy stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive, tubular corolla. Tragia emrichii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, often producing seeds that are dispersed by wind.
